alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, Knox, northeastern Whitley and southwestern Clay Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 536 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Faber, or 8 miles north of Williamsburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Woodbine around 540 PM EDT. Wilton, Moore Hill and North Corbin around 545 PM EDT. Arkle, Indian Creek, Rossland, Bertha Station, Dishman Springs, Gray, Swan Lake, Permon, Lynn Camp and Clate around 550 PM EDT. Lowell, Emmanuel, Bentley Station, Garrich, Baileys Switch, Swanpond and Tuttle around 555 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barbourville, Cannon, Jarvis, Heidrick, Yeager, Cranes Nest, Boone Heights, Knoxfork, Tedders, Artemus, Girdler, Green Road, Hinkle, Fount, Bimble, Haven, Baughman, Fletcher, Sprule, Woollum, Barnyard, Dewitt, Walker, Salt Gum, Hammond, Scalf and Ogle. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
